title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 154.7 - Capital gain or loss and capital loss carryover
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 154.7 - Capital gain or loss and capital loss carryover

State Regulations
(a) Where an individual or a trust changes
resident status during the taxable year, the net capital gains and losses
attributable to such individual or such trust are to be computed separately for
the resident period and for the nonresident period covered by the New York

State income tax returns required under this Part. In each case the computation
of the capital gain or loss to be reported is to be made in the same manner as
the corresponding Federal computation and on the same basis as if the taxable
year of such individual or such trust for Federal income tax purposes were
limited to the taxable period covered by the applicable New York State income
tax return, except that: (1)
the separate
computations applicable to the respective periods of residence and nonresidence
must include any special accruals required by section
154.10
of this

Part; and
(2)
the capital gain or
loss to be reported on the New York State nonresident income tax return for the
period of nonresidence includes only those capital gains and losses reported
for Federal income tax purposes which are derived from or connected with New

York State sources during the nonresident period (see section
132.7
and Part 138 of this Title). (b) See section
154.5
of this Part concerning New York minimum taxable income where an individual or
a trust has a Federal item of tax preference for a capital gain deduction which
is attributable to either the period of New York State residence or
nonresidence. (c) (1)
A short-term capital loss carryover
and/or a long-term capital loss carryover from a prior year to the year the
change of resident status occurred will retain its original character and be
treated in the same manner as for Federal income tax purposes in determining
the net capital gain or loss attributable to the respective periods of
residence and nonresidence. (2)

The
amount available as a carryover loss from a preceding year to the year the
change of residence occurred must, in accordance with Federal rules and
practice, be applied in chronological order to the New York State income tax
returns required under this Part as if separate Federal income tax returns had
been filed for corresponding taxable periods, except that where the change of
residence is from a nonresident to a resident, effect shall be given in any
subsequent year to any short-term and/or long-term capital loss carryover
computed on the New York State income tax return for the period subsequent to
the change of residence to the extent to which such short-term and/or long-term
capital loss carryover is includible in computing Federal adjusted gross income
of an individual or Federal taxable income of a trust for the subsequent year
or years. (3)

The amount available
as a carryover to the resident period in the year of the change of residence is
the same amount which would be available as a short-term and/or long-term
capital loss carryover if a Federal income tax return were being filed for the
period of residence. (4)

The
provisions of section
132.7
of this Title apply in determining the New York adjusted gross income of an
individual on the New York State nonresident personal income tax return for the
period of nonresidence. The provisions of Part 138 of this Title apply in
determining the New York taxable income of a trust on the New York State
fiduciary return for the period of nonresidence. Notes
